full_text: obser oI Siar tent oe ern ae eat 2024/KER/4416 CRL.MC 434/2024 1 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MRS. JUSTICE SOPHY THOMAS FRIDAY, THE 197 DAY OF JANUARY 2024 / 29TH POUSHA, 1945 CRL.MC NO. 434 OF 2024 CRIME NO.130/2024 OF Angamali Police Station, Ernakulam PETITIONER/ACCUSED: DR.RAMESHKUMAR AGED 59 YEARS S/O. RAMACHANDRAN NAIR(LATE) 18/448A, NAKSHATRA, GAYATHRI ENCLAVE, TELEPHONE EXCHANGE ROAD, MARADU ERNAKULAM DISTRICT., PIN - 682304 BY ADVS. M.SASINDRAN SATHEESHAN ALAKKADAN RESPONDENTS: 1 SWETHA EBEESH AGED 32 YEARS W/O.EBEESH NAMBIATH HOUSE, PATHUVAPURAM P.O., MARANGADAM, KARUKUTTY ALUVA TALUK, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT, PIN - 683576 2 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM., PIN - 682031 BY ADV S.R.SREEJITH SHARATHPARAMBIL RAJAN PP-SRI.PRASANTH M.P. THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 19.01.2024, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: ape 2024/KER/4416 CRL.MC 434/2024 2 ORDER Dated this the 19" day of January , 2024 This Crl.M.C. under Section 482 of Cr.P.C., is filed by the sole accused in Crime No.130 of 2024 of Angamali Police Station, Ernakulam, registered under Sections 354 and 354A of IPC, for quashing Annexure- Al FIR. 2. The prosecution allegation is that = on 20.11.2023, at about 3 p.m., the accused, who is a doctor in Appollo Hospital, Karukutty, Ernakulam District, tried to sexually abuse the 1* respondent in the treatment room of that hospital. 3. When the matter is taken up for consideration, learned counsel for the petitioner submitted that the matter stands settled between the petitioner and the 1* respondent/defacto complainant. The defacto complainant entered appearance through counsel, and submitted that iiseatea 2024/KER/4416 CRL.MC 434/2024 3 the matter stands settled. Annexures-AlII is the affidavit filed by her endorsing the settlement. She has no intention to proceed with the prosecution, and she has no objection in quashing Annexure- Al FIR in Crime No.130 of 2024 of Angamali Police Station, Ernakulam. 4. On _ instructions, learned Public Prosecutor submitted that the matter is settled and he produced signed statement of the 1* respondent. In that statement also, she has stated that she is not intending to proceed with the prosecution, and she has no objection in quashing Annexure- Al FIR in Crime No.130 of 2024 of Angamali Police Station, Ernakulam. 5. Since the matter stands settled, no purpose would be served by continuing the prosecution against the petitioner. 6. In the light of the principles laid down by the Apex Court in Gian Singh v. State of Punjab and Another; [(2012) 10 SCC 303)], and State of Madhya Pradesh v. Elz pears 2024/KER/4416 CRL.MC 434/2024 4 Laxmi Narayan and Others; [(2019) 5 SCC 688], this Court is of the view that the proceedings against the petitioner can be quashed on the basis of settlement. Moreover, the dispute is purely personal in nature and no public interest is involved in it. In the result, this Crl.MC is allowed, and Annexure- Al FIR in Crime No.130 of 2024 of Angamali Police Station, Ernakulam, stands quashed. Sd/- SOPHY THOMAS JUDGE smv Bl Sect ee oe ern Barns 2024/KER/4416 CRL.MC 434/2024 5 APPENDIX OF CRL.MC 434/2024 PETITIONER S ANNEXURES Annexure AI A TRUE COPY OF THE FIR IN CRIME NO.130/2024 OF ANKAMALI POLICE STATION, BRNAKULAM DISTRICT DATED 10-01-2024 Annexure AII A TRUE COPY OF THE AFFIDAVIT SWORN BY THE 1ST RESPONDENT, ENDORSING THE FACTUM OF COMPOUNDING THE ABOVE SAID OFFENCEHK IN THE ABOVE CASE DATED 12-01-2024.
